conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a glass hemisphere and parallel light.
The hemisphere sits on a flat base with light coming straight up towards the base.
Refractive index of glass is 1.5, affecting light bending.
Total internal reflection and critical angle concept introduced.
Calculate critical angle using refractive index.
Determine maximum distance from optical axis for emerging light.
Ray enters the base at distance r from optical axis and travels to center O.
Ray continues straight towards O without bending at the base.
Ray bends at spherical surface, total internal reflection occurs if angle exceeds critical angle.
Visualize ray path and geometry to relate r and angles.
Consider angle between radius at Q and ray as it leaves glass.
Angle of incidence at Q must be less than or equal to critical angle.
Find relationship between r and angle of incidence.
